alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 6:40PM CDT until August 15 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Geneva County in southeastern Alabama... Northern Walton County in the Panhandle of Florida... Western Holmes County in the Panhandle of Florida... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 640 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Lockhart to 10 miles north of Point Baker, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... De Funiak Springs, Geneva, Samson, Eglin Air Force Base, Union, Liberty, Paxton, Ponce De Leon, Westville, Oakwood Hills, Cluster Springs, Cerrogordo, Gritney, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Glendale, Pleasant Ridge, New Harmony, New Hope, Piney Grove and Caney Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
